Photo: Getty Images

The tumbling price of oil hammered commodity-dependent currencies as well as shares in oil and gas companies Friday, a day after the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries left its output target unchanged, diminishing hope of any imminent respite for the ailing commodity.
The tumbling price of oil hammered commodity-dependent currencies as well as shares in oil and gas companies, a day after OPEC kept its output target.
Brent crude was an additional 0.6% lower at $72.17 a barrel, its weakest level in four years, having already plummeted nearly 7% on Thursday.
